message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.NE 

The paper deals with the problem of synthesizing novel views of a 3D object from a single image, which is a common problem in computer vision and graphics. The proposed solution involves training a neural network on specific object categories (faces and chairs) using a recurrent convolutional encoder-decoder network. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves training a neural network end-to-end and disentangling latent factors of variation without using full supervision, which suggests that it may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also deals with 3D object models, which suggests that it may belong to the Graphics (cs.GR) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of a recurrent structure to capture long-term dependencies, which suggests that it may also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
